content.title: Final Stretch - A massive thank you and an update on our progress so far
content.creator:
ShleeCollaborator
March 6, 2025
content.content:
We're in the last few days of the campaign and we're smashed our goals by 255%!
Thank you so much to every single of the 2000+ backers who has supported us and our mission to accelerate the Pixelfed/Loops/Sup development and build our team to be sustainable and healthy. If you're interested in joining the project, please get in touch!
+ The "Pixelfed Foundation" is currently being pursued via the government of Alberta and we're looking forward to hitting that goal in 2025 as a non-profit dedicated to supporting and advancing the Pixelfed ecosystem at https://pixelfed.foundation/
+ We're partnering with Fastly Fast Forward for our CDN and S3 Storage needs to improve the performance of everybody on Pixelfed.social globally once enabled (while also lowering our monthly costs) so thank you to Fastly for their support.
+ We're started a new side project with the code-name "FediThreat", this is a security/moderation tool to allow fediverse administrators to raise risks such as spammers, phishing campaigns or other risks and stop them from traveling from instance to instance. This is currently in the proof of concept stage, and supports the goal of "expanding the moderation, security, privacy and safety platforms".
Pixelfed Updates
We're proud to see the team grow with 8 new people joining with various talents including Development, UX/UI and project management, and we're starting to put everything place for the success of Pixelfed (We need more PHP/Laravel programmers).
This progress has already resulted in two massive updates fixing major issues and quality of life improvements in the last few days...
"You love to see it"
Pixelfed v1.0.3 (Mar 4, 2025 at 8:10 PM)
Improved onboarding
Better sign-up flow
Fixed post edits
Notification fixes
Bug fixes and performance improvements
Pixelfed v1.0.4 (Mar 5, 2025 at 9:42 AM)
Fixed profile pagination
Faster image loading + BlurHashes
Better search (split accounts/hashtags)
Improved onboarding
Bug fixes and performance improvements
Loops Updates
Daniel is currently focusing his energy on the Pixelfed project, but the goal is to release the source code for the mobile app and the server "once it is ready in 2025". We appreciate the enthusiasm... 
This project is critical to us, but we need to plan for success because launching a platform focused on video that offers a snappy experience without *exploding in cost and requirements* is going to be a combination of good design, software, hardware, network, storage, security and more.
I (Shlee) am working with the team on building a dedicated server environment in multiple data-centers around the world to bring down the total cost of ownership, but also allow us to handle the 1000s of TBs of video traffic (plus storage requirements) that will likely be served by Loops once that project is kicked into full gear. (This is non-negotiable because that kind of traffic would bankrupt the fediverse in a week and we need to be good neighbors).
The bonus news is... once we're build the Fedi-CDN to host and serve all of this video content, we will be able to offer our excess compute/bandwidth to other fediverse platforms as a collaborative shared service.
Note: If you have experience or contacts in colocation/VPSs with lots of bandwidth. Get in touch with me/us at @shlee@aus.social on Mastodon
Sup
Sups planning and development will continue with the team starting with a UX/UI driven approach of building the application in Figma (or similar) first and designing the application to allow the developers to build to this spec instead of being a moving target.
Daniel will be launching the Sup homepages and supporting material in the near future.
Thanks to MikroTik for their shout-out
Because all of my networking equipment is MikroTik, I was thrilled to see Pixelfed and Loops mentioned in the promotional material for their new storage solution (this is not sponsored).
Finally
"We're so proud of the community, and we're looking forward to a very bright future for Pixelfed... The response from the fediverse in supporting this crowdfunding campaign will allow us to dream big.
As somebody who has great passion for the success of the Fediverse (but no coding skills), I am very happy to see the effect the success of this project has had on the team... and I'm glad that Daniel was convinced by my original pitch for this crowdfunding campaign. The fediverse is full of people who care about people and the effect social media has on the world. Let's build a better online culture for everybody.
Thank you again and always." - Shlee on behalf of Daniel Supernaut.

content.title: HELP WANTED: Growing our Developer Community
content.creator:
dansup
February 22, 2025
content.content:
Hey everyone!
I'm Daniel, and I have some exciting updates to share about Pixelfed's future. As our community grows, it's time to expand our team. I'm looking for passionate people to help mentor, guide, and bring this vision to life. From day one, our mission has been simple: giving people an alternative to closed, corporate social platforms.
Building Pixelfed has been an incredible journey, and I'm amazed by how our community has helped it grow into something truly special. As the main developer, I want to be transparent - to take Pixelfed to the next level, I need your support. I'm not aiming to be a "benevolent dictator for life" - I'm just the current lead maintainer helping guide the project.
Shlee and myself are working on creating a comprehensive roadmap for both Pixelfed and the Loops project. This will help everyone understand where we are now and the exciting places we're headed.
Thank you for being part of this journey!
Daniel
The Challenges We Face
Building and maintaining an open-source social network comes with its own set of challenges, including:
Development Bottlenecks: With a small group of developers, feature rollouts, bug fixes, and optimizations take longer than I’d like. We need to Triage and peer review PRs faster, and encourage new developers into the fold.
Community & Support overheads: Managing user feedback, triaging issues/reports, and engaging with the community is crucial to keeping the platform healthy.
Planning & Prioritizing: Currently all projects, features, issues and bugs are treated as equal. This allows for us to move quickly, but does lead to miscommunication or delays. We need to triage issues and build a roadmap to cover all parts of our platform.
Testing & Quality Assurance: With multiple platforms (Laravel backend, Nuxt/Vue web apps, and React Native mobile apps), ensuring stability across all versions is demanding.
Operations & Documentation: Keeping documentation up to date and organizing workflows for new contributors can be overwhelming.
UX/UI & Design: Improving user experience and refining the interface requires creative input from skilled designers.
Join us in building the future!
To overcome these challenges, I’m looking to build a passionate team. Here’s how you can get involved:
Developers:
PHP (Laravel) - for the backends.
Vue/Nuxt/React/Typescript - for web frontends.
React / React Native - for the iOS/Android mobile apps.
Supporting libraries such as Biomejs, Tamagui, etc
DB (MySQL/PostgreSQL), and Redis.
Operations:
Devops/CICD/Webapp Security - Automate and secure the Pixelfed Ecosystem.
Bare Metal/VMs Management - Plan for moving to Proxmox clusters in (colocated) regional DCs.
Networking / FCDN - Build a social network that pushes 100s of TB of video in an affordable/sustainable way.
Project Management: Focus on higher level goals/milestones, Roadmaps, Supporting everybody involved towards a common goal. 
Community Building: Triage issues. Support new users / encourage contributors, and share updates.
Operations & Documentation: Maintain end to end documentation.
Moderators/Safety: Design/Build tooling around safety, respond to support queries, and foster a positive environment in and around the fediverse.
Testers & QA: Assist in identifying and fixing bugs to improve reliability.
UX/UI Designers: Create intuitive and visually appealing designs using mockups and concept art using Figma or similar.
How to Get Involved
If you’re passionate about open-source, social networking, or just want to contribute to a meaningful project, we’d love to hear from you!
Join our Public Pixelfed Discord: https://discord.gg/mbvmCtVzEj and speak with the developer community members.
Visit our GitHub https://github.com/pixelfed, give our code a little review, and see what issues could be worked on/improved.
or just contact me via email at daniel@pixelfed.org
Looking forward to collaborating with you all!

content.title: Pixelfed Moderation Update: Stronger tools, safer spaces
content.creator:
ShleeCollaborator
February 2, 2025
content.content:
This February, we're rolling out our largest moderation update ever, reinforcing our commitment to a safer and more inclusive platform. Our goal is to empower users, protect vulnerable communities, and provide better tools for managing content effectively.
What’s New?
🔹 Allowlist Mode – Only federate with servers you approve. 
🔹 Built-in Blocklist Sharing – Share and enforce blocklists easily. 
🔹 Content Labels & Labeller – Community-driven content notes. 
🔹 Authorized Fetch – Enforce domain blocks more effectively. 
🔹 New Mod APIs – More flexibility and tools for moderators. 
🔹 AutoCheck – Automatically block servers that don’t meet your standards. 
🔹 Comment Controls – Take full control over conversations. 
🔹 Keyword Filters – Block specific hashtags and keywords. 
🔹 New Account Limit Actions – More ways to restrict bad actors. 
🔹 Mod Push Notifications – Get real-time moderation updates. 
🔹 New Report Types – Expanded options for reporting issues. 
🔹 Redesigned Content Warnings – Better visibility and customization. 
🔹 New Moderation Role & Dashboard – A dedicated hub for moderation tools.
A Step Forward
While this update isn’t perfect, it’s a significant step toward a better, more secure platform. We’re continuously working to improve these features and will be seeking community feedback soon.
Stay tuned for more updates, and thank you for helping us build a safer space for everyone! 🚀

content.title: 🚀 $100K Milestone Unlocked: The Fediverse Revolution Is Unstoppable!
content.creator:
dansup
January 28, 2025
content.content:
Dear Pixelfed Community,
We're absolutely thrilled to announce that we've not only reached our initial goal of $50,000 CAD but have now surpassed $100,000 in funding! This incredible milestone represents more than just numbers – it's a clear message that people believe in our vision for ethical, federated social media.
What This Means for Pixelfed
With this additional funding, we can now accelerate our plans and begin working on crucial infrastructure improvements. Here's what we're committed to delivering:
Immediate Focus
- Full-time development commitment to Pixelfed's core platform
- Accelerated development of both iOS and Android mobile apps
- Enhanced moderation and safety tools
- Expanded language support for global accessibility
Stretch Goals
We're excited to announce our extended stretch goals as we continue to grow:
✅ $100,000 (UNLOCKED) - Infrastructure Enhancement
  - Development of a specialized cloud/CDN platform for the Fediverse
  - Improved scaling capabilities to support our growing user base (currently over 300,000 accounts on pixelfed.social)
🎯 $200,000 - Pixelfed Foundation
  - Official registration of the Pixelfed Foundation as a legal entity
  - Creating a sustainable structure for long-term development and community governance
🎯 $300,000 - Team Expansion
  - Hiring additional developers to accelerate development across all platforms
  - Building a dedicated support team for community management
Extended Project Timeline
We're now able to commit to:
- Accelerated development schedule for Loops (our TikTok alternative)
- Earlier commencement of Sup messenger development
- Enhanced development of Pubkit for the broader Fediverse developer community
Looking Forward
This level of support not only validates our mission but also allows us to think bigger. We're not just building alternatives to major social platforms – we're creating a new standard for ethical social media that respects privacy, promotes safety, and brings people together without surveillance or tracking.
We remain committed to our open-source principles and the AGPL license, ensuring that every advancement we make benefits the entire Fediverse community.
Thank You
To everyone who has supported us – whether through backing this Kickstarter, spreading the word, or being part of our community – thank you. You're not just supporting Pixelfed; you're helping build a more ethical digital future.
Stay tuned for more updates as we begin implementing these expanded goals. The future is federated, and thanks to you, it's becoming a reality faster than we imagined.
With gratitude,
Daniel & The Pixelfed Team
Technical Update
Pixelfed and Loops are global social networks, and we aim to make our platforms as responsive and snappy as possible to ensure a consistent user experience, regardless of where you live. To achieve this, our operational and engineering teams are planning a "Fediverse Cloud," consisting of dedicated compute, storage, network traffic, and a Fediverse Content Delivery Network (FCDN).
Our goal is to build a global network that maintains a high quality of service for all officially supported flagship instances while extending support to other Fediverse instances. In the medium term, this will help reduce the "total cost of ownership" for instance administrators across the Fediverse.
We plan to establish at least 2–3 regional colocation centers to ensure a responsive and seamless experience for users worldwide
We want to build a Jortage style de-duplicated storage service to lower the cost of storage for regional instances.
We want to build a number of shared services such as outbound/transaction email services to allow fediverse administrators to join our mail pool for free/cheaper than mainstream.

Follow our progress:
- Web: https://pixelfed.org
- Fediverse: @pixelfed@pixelfed.social
- Development: https://github.com/pixelfed

comments.text: So grateful for everything you guys did for the community!Fingers crossed for the next phases. 🤞 Be careful not to overstretch your resources. Better focus on one (or two) cutting edge projects.

Congratulations, and thank you for setting and sharing those stretch goals! Very inspiring! I notice loops using Cloudflare for the domain registration, nameservers, login protection etc. Will the FCDN help to move Loops etc away from Cloudlfare?

(Speakers personally/not on behalf of Pixelfed) Running any social network at the size we want to reach will require us to work with numerous providers/companies, and the goal of the FCDN is to service as much as we can in-house... We expect to use the right tools for the job. As an open source project, we plan on run as much as we can / to the best of our ability, but for now, Cloudflare and their CDN in particular is keeping the wheels on. Stability and speed is the aim of the game right now. Scaling up globally to our own standards is going to be a massive problem to solve.
Thank you for the hard work! We’re excited to get started. 🙏🏽
